paragraphs.content: Chapter 5
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 5

paragraphs.content: Call now, if there be any that will answer thee; and to which of the saints wilt thou turn?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Call now, if there be any that will answer thee; and to which of the saints wilt thou turn?

paragraphs.content: For wrath killeth the foolish man, and envy slayeth the silly one.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For wrath killeth the foolish man, and envy slayeth the silly one.

paragraphs.content: I have seen the foolish taking root: but suddenly I cursed his habitation.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I have seen the foolish taking root: but suddenly I cursed his habitation.

paragraphs.content: His children are far from safety, and they are crushed in the gate, neither is there any to deliver them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: His children are far from safety, and they are crushed in the gate, neither is there any to deliver them.

paragraphs.content: Whose harvest the hungry eateth up, and taketh it even out of the thorns, and the robber swalloweth up their substance.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whose harvest the hungry eateth up, and taketh it even out of the thorns, and the robber swalloweth up their substance.

paragraphs.content: Although affliction cometh not forth of the dust, neither doth trouble spring out of the ground;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Although affliction cometh not forth of the dust, neither doth trouble spring out of the ground;

paragraphs.content: Yet man is born unto trouble, as the sparks fly upward.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yet man is born unto trouble, as the sparks fly upward.

paragraphs.content: I would seek unto God, and unto God would I commit my cause:
paragraphs.contentHtml: I would seek unto God, and unto God would I commit my cause:

paragraphs.content: Which doeth great things and unsearchable; marvellous things without number:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Which doeth great things and unsearchable; marvellous things without number:

paragraphs.content: Who giveth rain upon the earth, and sendeth waters upon the fields:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who giveth rain upon the earth, and sendeth waters upon the fields:

paragraphs.content: To set up on high those that be low; that those which mourn may be exalted to safety.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To set up on high those that be low; that those which mourn may be exalted to safety.

paragraphs.content: He disappointeth the devices of the crafty, so that their hands cannot perform their enterprise.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He disappointeth the devices of the crafty, so that their hands cannot perform their enterprise.

paragraphs.content: He taketh the wise in their own craftiness: and the counsel of the froward is carried headlong.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He taketh the wise in their own craftiness: and the counsel of the froward is carried headlong.

paragraphs.content: They meet with darkness in the daytime, and grope in the noonday as in the night.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They meet with darkness in the daytime, and grope in the noonday as in the night.

paragraphs.content: But he saveth the poor from the sword, from their mouth, and from the hand of the mighty.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But he saveth the poor from the sword, from their mouth, and from the hand of the mighty.

paragraphs.content: So the poor hath hope, and iniquity stoppeth her mouth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: So the poor hath hope, and iniquity stoppeth her mouth.

paragraphs.content: Behold, happy is the man whom God correcteth: therefore despise not thou the chastening of the Almighty:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, happy is the man whom God correcteth: therefore despise not thou the chastening of the Almighty:

paragraphs.content: For he maketh sore, and bindeth up: he woundeth, and his hands make whole.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For he maketh sore, and bindeth up: he woundeth, and his hands make whole.

paragraphs.content: He shall deliver thee in six troubles: yea, in seven there shall no evil touch thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He shall deliver thee in six troubles: yea, in seven there shall no evil touch thee.

paragraphs.content: In famine he shall redeem thee from death: and in war from the power of the sword.
paragraphs.contentHtml: In famine he shall redeem thee from death: and in war from the power of the sword.

paragraphs.content: Thou shalt be hid from the scourge of the tongue: neither shalt thou be afraid of destruction when it cometh.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou shalt be hid from the scourge of the tongue: neither shalt thou be afraid of destruction when it cometh.

paragraphs.content: At destruction and famine thou shalt laugh: neither shalt thou be afraid of the beasts of the earth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: At destruction and famine thou shalt laugh: neither shalt thou be afraid of the beasts of the earth.

paragraphs.content: For thou shalt be in league with the stones of the field: and the beasts of the field shall be at peace with thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thou shalt be in league with the stones of the field: and the beasts of the field shall be at peace with thee.

paragraphs.content: And thou shalt know that thy tabernacle shall be in peace; and thou shalt visit thy habitation, and shalt not sin.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And thou shalt know that thy tabernacle shall be in peace; and thou shalt visit thy habitation, and shalt not sin.

paragraphs.content: Thou shalt know also that thy seed shall be great, and thine offspring as the grass of the earth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou shalt know also that thy seed shall be great, and thine offspring as the grass of the earth.

paragraphs.content: Thou shalt come to thy grave in a full age, like as a shock of corn cometh in in his season.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou shalt come to thy grave in a full age, like as a shock of corn cometh in in his season.

paragraphs.content: Lo this, we have searched it, so it is; hear it, and know thou it for thy good.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lo this, we have searched it, so it is; hear it, and know thou it for thy good.
